docs.title: Welcome to Music API Doc
docs.text:
This is a sample Mkdocs generated Music API Developers' Documentation. Here is the OpenAPI/ Swagger generated API reference. Click Here

Welcome to the Music API developers' documentation. This guide is designed to help developers understand and integrate with our RESTful API, enabling you to manage playlists and users with ease.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Learn what the API does, key concepts, and how it fits into your music-related application.

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: Dive into the technical details — all available endpoints, request/response formats, and error codes.

docs.title: Use Cases
docs.text: Explore real-world examples and tutorials on using the API, including quickstarts and webhook integration.

docs.title: Tools
docs.text: Download the OpenAPI specification and access tools like Swagger for testing.

docs.title: Changelog
docs.text: Track updates to the API and changes across different versions.

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: Ready to build? Start here: Authentication Guide

docs.title: Need Help?
docs.text: Have questions or issues? Contact our team at support@muzicplayz.com

docs.title: API Authentication
docs.text: All Music API endpoints require a basic authorization in the security header.

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
/playlist:
  get:
    Host: (https://api.muzicplayz.com/v3)  
    security:
      - basauth: []

docs.title: API Endpoints
docs.text: The following endpoints allow you to Get, Create & Delete your Playlists via the Music API.

docs.title: Returns the playlists - GET Playlists
docs.text: Gets all the song playlists of a user.

docs.title: URL
docs.text: GET https://api.muzicplayz.com/v3/playlist

docs.title: Query Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Description Type Required limit Number of playlists to return integer No offset Index of the first playlist to return (e.g., 0 = start at beginning, 10 = skip first 10) integer No search Filter/Search for playlists matching a specific keyword or type of song string No

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: Header Name Description Value Required security Basic Authorization Yes

docs.title: Sample Request
docs.text:
GET https://api.muzicplayz.com/v3/playlist?limit=10&offset=20&search=jazz 
  security: 
    - basauth: []

docs.title: Details of the playlist with songs.
/components/schemas/playlistwithsongs
docs.text: Element Description Type Comments id Id of the playlist integer name Name of the playlist string songs Array of song details array Check song details

docs.title: Details of related to the songs in the playlist.
/components/schemas/song
docs.text: Element Description Type Comments id Id of the song integer title Name of the song string artist Name of the song string

docs.title: Sample Response
docs.text:
[
  {
    "id": 0,
    "name": "string",
    "songs": [
      {
        "id": 0,
        "title": "string",
        "artist": "string"
      }
    ]
  }
]

docs.title: Creates a playlist - POST Playlist
docs.text: Creates a song playlist.

docs.title: URL
docs.text: POST https://api.muzicplayz.com/v3/playlist

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: Header Name Description Value Required security Basic Authorization Yes

docs.title: Details of the new song playlist
/components/schemas/newPlaylist
docs.text: Element Description Type Required name Name of the playlist string Yes songIds Array of song Ids array Yes

docs.title: Sample Request
docs.text:
POST https://api.muzicplayz.com/v3/playlist
  security: 
    - basauth: []
  requestBody:
    required: true
    content:
      application/json:
      schema:
        $ref: "#/components/schemas/newPlaylist"

docs.title: Details of the playlist with songs.
/components/schemas/playlistwithsongs
docs.text: Element Description Type Comments id Id of the playlist integer name Name of the playlist string songs Array of song details array Check song details

docs.title: Details of related to the songs in the playlist.
/components/schemas/song
docs.text: Element Description Type Comments id Id of the song integer title Name of the song string artist Name of the song string

docs.title: Sample Response
docs.text:
{
  "id": 0,
  "name": "string",
  "songs": [
    {
      "id": 0,
      "title": "string",
      "artist": "string"
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: Returns a specific playlist - GET Specific Playlist
docs.text: Gets a specific song playlist.

docs.title: URL
docs.text: GET https://api.muzicplayz.com/v3/playlist/{playlist-id}

docs.title: Path Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Description Type Required playlist-id Id of the playlist to return integer Yes

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: Header Name Description Value Required security Basic Authorization Yes

docs.title: Sample Request
docs.text:
GET https://api.muzicplayz.com/v3/playlist/{playlist-id}
  security:
    - basauth: []
  parameters:
    - name: playlist-id
      in: path
      required: true
      schema:
        type: string

docs.title: Details of the playlist with songs.
/components/schemas/playlistwithsongs
docs.text: Element Description Type Comments id Id of the playlist integer name Name of the playlist string songs Array of song details array Check song details

docs.title: Details of related to the songs in the playlist.
/components/schemas/song
docs.text: Element Description Type Comments id Id of the song integer title Name of the song string artist Name of the song string

docs.title: Sample Response
docs.text:
[
  {
    "id": 0,
    "name": "string",
    "songs": [
      {
        "id": 0,
        "title": "string",
        "artist": "string"
      }
    ]
  }
]

docs.title: Deletes a specific playlist - DELETE Specific Playlist
docs.text: Deletes a specific song playlist.

docs.title: URL
docs.text: DELETE https://api.muzicplayz.com/v3/playlist/{playlist-id}

docs.title: Path Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Description Type Required playlist-id Id of the playlist to return integer Yes

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: Header Name Description Value Required security Basic Authorization Yes

docs.title: Sample Request
docs.text:
DELETE https://api.muzicplayz.com/v3/playlist/{playlist-id}
  security:
    - basauth: []
  parameters:
    - name: playlist-id
      in: path
      required: true
      schema:
        type: string

docs.title: Details of the error message in response.
/components/schemas/error
docs.text: Element Description Type Comments errormsg Id of the playlist integer logdata Name of the playlist string Check logdata details Element Description Type Comments entry Id of the song integer date Name of the song integer

docs.title: Sample Response
docs.text:
{
  "errormsg": "string",
  "logdata": {
    "entry": 0,
    "date": 0
  }
}

docs.title: Returns a specific playlist as Image - GET Specific Playlist as Image
docs.text: Gets a specific song playlist as an image.

docs.title: URL
docs.text: GET https://api.muzicplayz.com/v3/playlist/{playlist-id}/image

docs.title: Path Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Description Type Required playlist-id Id of the playlist to return integer Yes

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: Header Name Description Value Required security Basic Authorization Yes

docs.title: Sample Request
docs.text:
GET https://api.muzicplayz.com/v3/playlist/{playlist-id}/image
  security:
    - basauth: []
  parameters:
    - name: playlist-id
      in: path
      required: true
      schema:
        type: string

docs.title: Sample Response
docs.text: string

docs.title: Errors & Status Codes
docs.text: The Music API uses standard HTTP status codes to indicate success or failure.

docs.title: Success Responses
docs.text: Code Description Comments 200 OK Successful Response for all operations

docs.title: Error Responses
docs.text: Code Description Comments 401 Unauthorised Already Deleted for Delete operation

docs.title: Example Error
docs.text:
{
  "errormsg": "This playlist is already deleted."
}

docs.title: API Version History
docs.text: This page documents all publicly released versions of the Music API.

docs.title: Version 1.0.0 – Initial Public Release
docs.text: Release Date: 2025-03-15 Status: Stable Version Type: Major Release

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: Version 1.0.0 marks the first official release of the Music API. This version includes all core playlist management features and introduces basic authentication.

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
1. Playlist Management Endpoints POST /playlist : Create a new playlist GET /playlist : Fetch all playlists for the authenticated user DELETE /playlist/{playlist_id} : Delete a playlist by Id

  2. Authentication Basic Authentication via - 

    security:
  - basauth: []

  3. Rate Limiting/ Throttling Requests are none by default.

docs.title: Technical Details
docs.text:
• API versioning is supported via the base path (/v3)
  • JSON is the default request and response format
  • All endpoints follow RESTful principles
  • Error responses follow a unified schema :
  {
    "errormsg": "This is an error msg"
  }

docs.title: Documentation & Tools
docs.text:
• Static documentation site available via MkDocs
  • Generated via Swagger/OpenAPI specifications

docs.title: Known Limitations
docs.text:
• No support for file uploads or media streaming yet
  • Webhooks and SDKs are not yet available

docs.title: Versioning Policy
docs.text:
The Music API follows Semantic Versioning :

MAJOR: Incompatible API changes

MINOR: Backward-compatible feature additions

PATCH: Backward-compatible bug fixes

docs.title: Version 1.1.0 – New Features Release
docs.text: Release Date: 2025-04-26 Status: Stable Version Type: Minor Release

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: Version 1.1.0 marks the new features release of the Music API. This version includes some more playlist management features with basic authentication.

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
1. Playlist Management Endpoints GET /playlist/{playlist-id} : Fetch a playlist by Id GET /playlist/{playlist_id}/image : Fetch a playlist by Id as image

  2. Authentication Basic Authentication via - 

    security:
  - basauth: []

  3. Rate Limiting/ Throttling Requests are none by default.

docs.title: Technical Details
docs.text:
• API versioning is supported via the base path (/v3)
  • JSON is the default request and response format
  • All endpoints follow RESTful principles

docs.title: Documentation & Tools
docs.text:
• Static documentation site available via MkDocs
  • Generated via Swagger/OpenAPI specifications

docs.title: Known Limitations
docs.text:
• No support for file uploads or media streaming yet
  • Webhooks and SDKs are not yet available

docs.title: Versioning Policy
docs.text:
The Music API follows Semantic Versioning :

MAJOR: Incompatible API changes

MINOR: Backward-compatible feature additions

PATCH: Backward-compatible bug fixes
Future versions will be listed below as they are released.

docs.title: Key Concepts
docs.text: Understanding the core concepts of the Music API will help you build efficiently.

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text: All API requests require a Basic authorisation.

docs.title: Resources
docs.text: Our core resource is the playlist. Each playlist is associated with a user and can contain metadata like id, description, and song-ids.

docs.title: Pagination & Filtering
docs.text:
• Use query parameters to paginate large responses
  • Filtering options are available on selected endpoints

docs.title: Errors
docs.text: The API returns standardized HTTPS status codes with clear error messages to help you debug effectively.

docs.title: What is the Music API?
docs.text: The Music API is a RESTful web service that allows developers to manage and manipulate playlists like playlist & song-related data.

docs.title: Core Capabilities
docs.text:
• Create user playlists
  • Retrieve a list of playlists or a specific playlist
  • Delete existing playlists using playlist-id
  • Retrieve a specific playlist as image

docs.title: Use Cases
docs.text:
• Build custom music playlists
  • Automate playlist creation, management & deletion

docs.title: API Design
docs.text:
• RESTful Architecture
  • Written in YAML
  • JSON-formatted requests and responses
  • Secured with Basic authentication

docs.title: Swagger / OpenAPI Specification
docs.text: The Music API is documented using the OpenAPI Specification (OAS) — a standardized format for describing RESTful APIs.

docs.title: Why Use the OpenAPI Spec?
docs.text:
• Easily visualize and explore endpoints using Swagger UI
  • Validate request/response formats

docs.title: Swagger UI
docs.text:
You can access the Swagger UI Here

This interactive documentation lets you:

  • Try out endpoints directly in the browser
  • View expected request/response payloads
  • See all available endpoints, schemas and parameters

docs.title: 📦 Download the OpenAPI Spec
docs.text:
To integrate with tooling or generate clients, download the OpenAPI (YAML) spec:

  • musicapi.yaml

docs.title: Quickstart Guide
docs.text: Get up and running with the Music API in minutes.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Basic API Authorization
  • HTTP client (like curl)

docs.title: Step 1: Create a Playlist
docs.text:
curl -X POST https://muzicplayz.com/v3/playlist \
  -d '{"name": "Chill Vibes", "songIds": [22, 3, 11, 45, 54]}'

docs.title: Step 2: Fetch Playlist as Image
docs.text: curl -X GET https://muzicplayz.com/v3/playlist/{playlist-id}/image \

docs.title: Step 3: Fetch Playlists
docs.text: curl -X GET https://muzicplayz.com/v3/playlists \

docs.title: Step 4: Fetch Specific Playlist
docs.text: curl -X GET https://muzicplayz.com/v3/playlists/{playlist-id} \

docs.title: Step 5: Delete Playlist
docs.text: curl -X DELETE https://muzicplayz.com/v3/playlists/{playlist-id} \

docs.title: Real-World Scenarios
docs.text: Here are some ways developers are using the Music API:

docs.title: Custom Music Apps
docs.text:
• Build personalized music playlists.
  • Let users create, find, and manage playlists.

docs.title: Social Integration
docs.text: • Allow users to sync their favorite tracks at one place.

docs.title: Data-Driven Playlists
docs.text:
• Generate playlists using AI/music analysis
  • Automate playlist curation based on time of day, mood, or activity

docs.title: Batch Operations
docs.text: • Sync music libraries from other platforms
